etymologies: late 16th century (denoting lodestone): from Greek sidēros ‘iron’+ -ite

definitions: a brown mineral consisting of ferrous carbonate, occurring as the main component of some kinds of ironstone or as rhombohedral crystals in mineral veins.
shortDefinitions: brown mineral consisting of ferrous carbonate, occurring as main component of some kinds of ironstone

definitions: a meteorite consisting mainly of nickel and iron.
shortDefinitions: meteorite consisting mainly of nickel and iron
